description: This trap is sent when number of FCFs reached maximum allowed limit in VLAN.

event.Summary: Maximum FCF limit reached in VLAN $v1

description: This object refers to the Vlan Index for which the FIP Snooping
trap is being sent.
variables.name: F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSTrapVlanIndex

description: This trap is sent when number of ENodes reached maximum allowed limit in the system.
This trap is sent when number of sessions reached maximum allowed limit in the system.
This trap is sent when a new FCF discovered (Discovery Advertisement is received from FCF) is dropped,
as the maximum allowed FCFs limit in a VLAN is already reached.

event.Summary: New FCF discovery packet was dropped on interface $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FcfDroppedTrap F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSTrapVlanIndex u 9999 F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSFCFIntf u 9999 F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSTrapMacAddr s EXAMPL

description: This object refers to the Vlan Index for which the FIP Snooping
trap is being sent.
variables.name: F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSTrapVlanIndex

description: Inteface on which FCF is discovered.
variables.name: F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSFCFIntf

description: This object refers to the FCF or Enode MAC Address for which
the FIP Snooping trap is being sent.
variables.name: F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSTrapMacAddr

description: This trap is sent when a new ENode discovered is dropped,
as the maximum allowed ENodes limit in the system is already reached.

event.Summary: New ENode discovery packet was dropped on interface $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10ENodeDroppedTrap F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSTrapVlanIndex u 9999 F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSENodeIntf u 9999 F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSTrapMacAddr s EXAMPL

description: This object refers to the Vlan Index for which the FIP Snooping
trap is being sent.
variables.name: F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSTrapVlanIndex

description: Interface to which the ENode is connected.
variables.name: F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSENodeIntf

description: This object refers to the FCF or Enode MAC Address for which
the FIP Snooping trap is being sent.
variables.name: F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSTrapMacAddr

description: This trap is sent when a new session request received is dropped
as the maximum allowed session limit in system is already reached.

event.Summary: New session request packet was dropped on interface $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10SessionRequestDroppedTrap F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSTrapVlanIndex u 9999 F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSENodeIntf u 9999 F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSTrapMacAddr s EXAMPL

description: This object refers to the Vlan Index for which the FIP Snooping
trap is being sent.
variables.name: F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSTrapVlanIndex

description: Interface to which the ENode is connected.
variables.name: F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSENodeIntf

description: This object refers to the FCF or Enode MAC Address for which
the FIP Snooping trap is being sent.
variables.name: F10-FIPSNOOPING-MIB::dF10FIPSTrapMacAddr

description: This trap is sent when there is a problem in installing the ACL entries
due to no space or hardware failure

event.Summary: Problem in installing the ACL entries due to no space or hardware failure
